profile_summary_bkgd:
I am an expert in media strategy, planning and buying. For over 20 years, my special has been interactive and digital. I am privileged to be in demand as a regular speaker on web metrics, web advertising infrastructure and cross media strategies.

My company, Mediasmith is very active in new media forms, new media technologies, analytics. and how these work in conjunction with web display, mobile, social, web video and traditional media.

In April of 2012, I was inducted into the sfBIG Hall of Fame. At the spring 2007 San Francisco @d:tech, I was awarded one of the first ever Individual Achievement Awards. I am greatly honored to have received this award.

Previous accomplishments include that of my company being named to the San Francisco Business Times 100 Fastest Growing Private Companies (#47). Other awards include an Effie.

I have contributed articles and interviews in an extensive range of media over the past two decades. I am a regular speaker at Industry events including iMedia, @d:tech, I-Com, Digiday and others. I write regularly for a number of industry publications and Web sites including Fast Company, and iMediaConnection. I have had a major involvement in national committee work to establish and refine standards in metrics, business practices and financial issues for Interactive advertising with organizations such as the 4A’s, IAB, OPA and the ARF. My advisory board involvement includes OPA, and others. I work with a number of start-ups on their board or advisory board.

I am best known for my work to help further standards in the advertising media industry. This includes work done with I/PRO in the early days for site audits, lobbying for the impression definition standard recently adopted, standards in reach and frequency and other issues as well as founding the ARF's Online Media Council and serving as chair for 2+ years.

擅长领域:Technology, Hardware, Software, Media, Consumer digital marketplace, Interactive media planning and buying, Entertainment, Video games, Travel, Beverage (Liquor, Wine, Beer, Soft Drinks, Health and fruit drinks, etc.), Finance, BTB, Retail and many more.

profile_summary_bkgd:
I am a computer scientist and entrepreneur who has focused on interactive 3D and using 3D as a basis for new user environments and entertainment for over thirty years. I create world-class teams and ship impossible products.

I am CTO of Wearality Corporation, where I lead a world class team in developing and marketing next generation human/computer interface technologies. Our first product is the Wearality Sky - an open design designed to work with smart phones and featuring the widest field of view lenses that are in focus everywhere with minimal color distortion and the widest exit pupil.

As Chief Innovation Officer and Senior Fellow at Lockheed Martin MST I have focused on next generation human centric computing and collaboration platforms. I have developed many key technologies including extreme wide field of view lenses for AR (over 140° field of view) and immersive VR (180° field of view with a single lens). I am also the designer of the DoD Virtual World Framework – a browser based collaboration system that will serve as a common platform for training across all of the services in the Department of Defense.

I was the chief architect of the open source Croquet Project, where I worked with Alan Kay (Turing Award winner, father of the personal computer, inventor of object oriented programming, and creator of the Dynabook), Andreas Raab, and David P. Reed (architect of TCP/IP). I was CTO and co-founder of Teleplace, Inc. providing a collaboration platform developed for enterprises.

In 1987, I created "The Colony", the very first realtime 3D adventure game/shooter and the precursor to today's first-person shooters. The game won the "Best Adventure Game of the Year" award from MacWorld Magazine. In 1988, I used these technologies to create a virtual set and virtual camera system used by James Cameron for the movie The Abyss. I founded Virtus Corporation in 1990 and developed Virtus Walkthrough, the first real-time 3D design application for personal computers.

profile_summary_bkgd:
Executive Technologist

My forte and my passion is growing small companies into mid-size businesses. I serve in both product and technical executive roles, as needed. On the product side this means refining the product idea down to its essence to get it out sooner, setting up metric-based decision making up and down the chain, and managing the product teams. On the technical side, I dive in to make the right architectural choices up front, bring in best practices in tools and coding, and then hire great people to build strong teams. Technical hiring is the #1 hurdle for most companies and it is one of my core strengths.

On an individual level I like to get my hands dirty with the usual stacks: angular/django/python, jquery/node/redis/mongo, php/apache/mysql, along with pure server side and api implementations. Functionally, I've built full consumer-facing sites, API servers, telecom application infrastructure, and mobile applications. I've used a fair number of javascript client frameworks for web (although I still consider CSS a black black art)... for mobile MVP's I like the idea of native wrappers around web frameworks (i.e., cordova/phonegap + native iOS/Android plugins in Objective C / Java or react native). It's quick to set up and lets the product side iterate using existing web technology resources. For raw speed, I've architected and built telecom grade full-stack multithreaded C++ servers on top of mysql/memcache/boost.

Specialties:
Scaling small companies to medium size businesses.
Deep technical understanding coupled with product execution and strategic vision
Technical hiring

Área de Engenharia: levantamento e quantificação de materiais de obras civis a partir de documentações de projeto e de processos licitatórios; dimensionamento de estruturas (fundações, vigas, pilares e lajes) para auxilio à elaboração de propostas; elaboração de pareceres técnicos de equipamentos industriais (trocadores de calor, vasos de pressão, bombas e compressores); adequação de desenhos técnicos no AutoCAD; ambientação aos conceitos, práticas, técnicas, equipamentos e vocabulário relacionado ao ambiente industrial com foco no setor de Óleo e Gás.

Área de Suprimentos: auxílio à administração de contratos; pesquisa e contato com fornecedores e equipes de obra; elaboração de ordens de compra e administração das mesmas através do RM TOTVS e planilhas de controle.

profile_summary_bkgd:
Sou graduado em Engenharia Civil pela Universidade Federal de São Carlos (2015) e Técnico em Automação Industrial pela ETEC Lauro Gomes (2008). Estudei na Universidade Tecnológica de Rochester (EUA) com bolsa integral pelo Programa Ciência sem Fronteiras nos anos de 2013 e 2014.

Atuei como estagiário nas áreas de Saneamento, Sistemas Construtivos e Engenharia Industrial. A mais recente experiência foi na Método Potencial Engenharia, empresa líder em soluções de engenharia e construções de alta complexidade na área de Engenharia Civil e especializada em engenharia, construção e manutenção de grande porte na área Industrial.

Tenho como grandes características o autodesenvolvimento, a inquietação pela busca de inovações e melhorias, carisma, humildade, honestidade e espírito de dono, este caracterizado pela responsabilidade e o comprometimento, considerando sempre o longo prazo.

Minha fascinação está voltada às Engenharias Civil e Industrial e tudo aquilo que as cercam, como desenvolvimento de infraestrutura, construção e manutenção, novas tecnologias, novas tendências, sustentabilidade e gerenciamento de projetos. Estou sempre aberto a novas ideias e oportunidades que sejam mutuamente benéficas.

profile_summary_bkgd:
With 25+ years, highly experienced IT executive in software, sales, business development and a focus on leading people as coach.

Dipl. Informatiker Wolfgang Schmidt is acting partner and the managing director of X-INTEGRATE Soft-ware & Consulting GmbH. He has a proven track record as an adept engineer, consultant, project leader and IT manager in software engineering and IT consultancy. He started his career in 1988 as a software developer and today he focuses on emerging business integration technology spaces to leverage hybrid cloud connectivity, BPM and advanced analytics as agility driver for companies and the industry's move toward process digitization and Industrie 4.0. Furthermore, Wolfgang Schmidt is a co-founder and board member of the Cloud-EcoSystem e.V. which is an active network for cloud business to leverage new cloud technologies, empowers the SaaS business operations of software vendors across all sectors, bundles expertise in a tight network and generates synergies. As a certified expert in cloud architecture, integration and interoperability, he supports the ecosystem in the hybrid-cloud-IT topics to implement innovative business models.

He is a frequent speaker at conferences covering SOA, Cloud IT and enterprise computing topics and is a recognized technology thought leader who has appeared in different German publications. You can follow Wolfgang at @xintegrate on Twitter or on the X-INTEGRATE blog.

Technology does not have a value in itself - it needs to serve a purpose. Connecting the business goals to the delivery roadmap sometimes means mastering a beast. But it helps enormously: The IT teams are much more motivated when they know what they work for, success is measurable. Still, they can work in an agile manner. But both sides need to accept agile. The business side needs to be able to formulate an agile roadmap. For the IT part, implementing JIRA does not mean to be agile. And sometimes agile needs to fit into a waterfall because technology serves a purpose and it might be marketing. Innovation does not mean to have nice ideas. It means to identify a void in the market, build a solution for it in time and in an adaptive manner, and get it to market. Then have the tenacity to make it successful. Plan for tenacity from the beginning.
Combining marketing, sales, technology, innovation, people management and leadership - that's my world. Doing, learning and teaching all about it - that's my passion.
Being a consultant enables me to share what I learned to the outside world.

profile_summary_bkgd:
Being creative and having dreams is one thing but it needs an excellent team, motivation and dedication to make things happen. I can look back on a track record of software projects in all kinds of software companies - all delivered despite all odds, prototypes or full-blown projects, all out of the box, all visionary and ahead of time. We build a cloud-based tracking system in a few weeks using the latest and greatest of Amazon's Cloud infrastructure because there was a business need. This is what motivates me. This is how I can motivate others.
I am an evangelist by heart. Explaining technology in a way that amuses and motivates, sparks discussions, is the essence for this. I believe in evangelism as the better channel marketing. To be better in this, I wanted to learn about technology, audience marketing and consumer marketing programs, sales, partner strategy and partner business, operations, leadership... this is the reason why I did all these jobs and all these studies. I am an reserve officer, a student, a VP, a developer, a researcher, a marketing man, a sales guy, a gamer, a runner, and a rescue diver. I know my limitations and they never limited me...
You will never find real change if you play safe... you need to risk, break things and rebuild. The sky is the limit, if you have a plan. That's why I am interested in PRINCE2, corporate finance, marketing and sales... because technology does not stand alone.

I am an award-winning graphic designer with twenty years of experience developing and implementing visual identities for a diverse range of clients. The goal of each collaborative venture is a design that addresses functionality in an intelligent, imaginative way.

Working in print or online, my approach is thoroughly results-oriented. During my tenure at the Met, site traffic increased from 8.3 million visitors in 2002 to 34.7 million in 2009, with a corresponding upswing in revenue from $3.6 million to $10 million, the result of integrating creative design and strategic marketing. Whether generating web traffic, increasing profitability through an innovative approach to sales or fund-raising, or developing brand image, I have demonstrated expertise and a proven track record.

profile_summary_bkgd:
Unsere Kunden sind Führungskräfte, die nach Antworten in schwierigen Situationen suchen:

- Wie verkaufe ich Mitarbeitern etwas, hinter dem ich selbst nicht mit voller Überzeugung stehe?
- Wie gehe ich mit inkompetenten Mitarbeitern um?
- Wie schaffe ich es, dass meine Mitarbeiter nicht nur Dienst nach Vorschrift machen?
- Wie erkenne ich Machtspiele im Unternehmen und wie wird meine Leistung auch ganz oben anerkannt?
- Wie löse ich Probleme und Streitereien zwischen meinen Mitarbeitern?
- Wie leite ich souverän meine Besprechungen und Meetings?
- Wie lege ich als neue Chefin/neuer Chef einen guten Start hin?

Bei uns gibt es Antworten und Tipps&Tricks für Ihre drängendsten Führungsfragen!

Was Sie bei uns erwartet:

::: Ja, wir arbeiten mit Führungskräften, deren Situation wir selbst kennen und deren Erfahrungen wir teilen. Wir wissen wovon wir sprechen und „wo der Schuh drückt".

::: Ja, wir geben Ihnen als Führungskraft in unseren Trainings und Coachings tatsächlich Tipps und Ratschläge. Unsere Kunden erwarten dies von uns und bezahlen uns dafür.

Sollten Sie also zu denjenigen gehören, die an den Quatsch glauben, dass „Ratschläge auch Schläge sind“, dann wenden Sie sich bitte an diese Seminar-Anbieter aus der „Weichspüler-Ecke“.

::: Ja, wir streben Exzellenz an und hassen Mittelmaß.
Daher sind wir als Trainer und Coaches unseren Kunden und Führungskräften gegenüber offen, klar und direkt.
Wir nehmen uns dabei tatsächlich heraus, auch Unangenehmes anzusprechen, denn wir geben Ihnen als Führungskraft keine Gefälligkeits-Feedbacks, sondern legen „den Finger auch in die Wunde“.

• Marketing and Presentation – I work directly with clients to understand their requirements so that I can interpret their needs and present solutions. I can bridge the gap between the kitchen and sales to help build businesses with effective client interaction.

My name is James Anderson, and I am a passionate, licensed landscape architect with a wealth of multi-disciplinary design experience from large, world-class firms and small landscape architecture offices.

Throughout my career, I have assisted architects, engineers (civil, HVAC, and MEP), and interior designers with my design, presentation graphics, and drafting abilities. There is no design problem which intimidates me -- I thrive on difficult design challenges.

★ One senior associate director once called me one of the best designers he has ever seen. ★

My responsibilities have run the gamut from project manager and lead designer to drafter and renderer. I have worked on a wide variety of projects, such as convention centers, museums, hospitals, hotels, retail centers, academic facilities, residential community development, corporate headquarters, correctional facilities, street scapes, urban plazas, casinos, Department of Transportation projects, and a zoo.

Along with superior hand-rendering skills, I also have a command of AutoCAD, Microstation, Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Photoshop, Corel Draw, and Microsoft Office.

I offer expertise, creativity, and the talent to produce innovative designs and outstanding presentation graphics which exceed client expectations and contribute to company success and profitability.

I love what I do, and I take my work seriously. My focus is on doing my best work on every project. As the realization of the importance of LEED principles and sustainability grows, I hope to join my colleagues in urban planning, architecture and engineering in playing an increasingly significant role in conservation, intelligent water management, environmental restoration, and the creation of livable, low-impact communities, which create value.

If you have any questions or would like to discuss my experiences, please connect with me on LinkedIn. Please refer to your opportunity in your request to connect.

profile_summary_bkgd:
Highly creative, results driven leader with over 10 years of experience in organizational management of both public and private sectors. Has a track record of building relationships that produces results. Familiar with budgeting, management, administrative support, curriculum development and implementation.

My passionate plea for reducing the rate of recidivism within the ex-offender population led to the creation of Becoming One Community. This organization under my direction has assisted over 700 people with their career search throughout the city of Houston via such events as job readiness training workshops (created my own curriculum) ,and career networking events within the past three years.

I have worn many hats such as administrative assistant, event planner, customer service representative, curriculum writer, social media strategist, workshop facilitator, and of course the community outreach. Encompassing those many hats has allowed me the opportunity to fine tune my speaking abilities, manage diverse projects, and navigate the challenges.

My strengths are: strong community leadership, volunteerism, excellent customer service, project management skills, and the ability to connect with diverse groups of people. These strengths are a testimony to my values: integrity, authenticity, respect, and communication.

My personal mantra: “To be an impactful force that transforms lives!”
